title: Redfin Stock Is Poised to Catch Up to Broader Housing Market, Analyst Says
text:
Redfin stock has lagged the broader market in 2019 despite an improving picture for housing. Susquehanna argues that the real estate broker’s shares won’t continue to fall behind.

The back story. Redfin shares (ticker: RDFN) are up 9% year to date, about half of the S&P 500’s rise over the same time. It’s not for lack of strength in the housing market, as the SPDR S&P Homebuilders ETF (XHB) is up more than 33% in 2019, helped by low interest rates, which in turn lower mortgage costs and increase affordability,...
description: There are catalysts for Redfin’s shares including the company’s use of technology, its increased market share and its use of technology.
